American Heart Association | American Stroke Association
American Heart Association | American Stroke Association

Responsible for fundraising on behalf of the American Heart Association in the Greater Phoenix area including foundation relations, corporate relations and individual gifts for association's Halle Heart Children's Museum.

Responsible for executive communications for a $4 billion global biotechnology company with more than 10,000 employees. Work exclusively with the chief executive officer, president, head of global human resources and other key business area leaders to develop communications programs for internal and external audiences. Write speeches, develop presentations, ghostwrite materials including announcements and blogs, create videos and develop other vehicles to effectively position leaders based on personal brands. Work with other members of the creative communications team to develop a wide range of employee communications events and vehicles including town hall meetings, videos, leadership meetings, intranet site and more. Work with cross-functional teams on large-scale communications initiatives including organizational changes, compensation and benefits programs, site closures, acquisitions and other key projects.

Responsible for all aspects of employee communications for a wide variety of internal clients including Human Resources, Information Technology, Marketing, Corporate Development, Finance and others. Acted as internal consultant to the business to develop and execute communications strategies using vehicles such as electronic newsletters, mass email, video, executive messages, podcasts, intranet, blogs, face-to-face meetings, video conferencing, web conferencing and more. Created and executed large and small communications campaigns for company initiatives including change management, acquisitions, workforce reductions, benefits enrollment and technology. Managed staff of two communications professionals who provided support on all activities. Led communications technology initiatives for Apollo Group including blogging, video, intranet and social networking.

The Alliance of Arizona Nonprofits is a unifying association formed in 2004 to advance the common interests of more than 20,000 nonprofits in the Grand Canyon State. We are a statewide organization of, by, and for all of Arizona’s nonprofits. The Alliance is an action-oriented group of partners across the state – both nonprofits and those in the community who support them – dedicated to furthering the common interests of Arizona’s nonprofits.The Alliance does this by serving, supporting, protecting, and promoting the nonprofit sector. More information: http://www.arizonanonprofits.org/

recommendations: April L. Bogle
Senior Communications Strategist, Change Agent & Storyteller
June 9, 2009, April L. managed Len directly

Len is a first-rate communication leader with impressive experience and excellent skills that make him a highly effective consultant and organizational executive. A strategic thinker, he brings his laser sharp mind and strong relationship building abilities to quickly find solutions to tough issues in complicated environments. As a leader, he builds strong and loyal teams and wins the support of those around him. Len is an excellent writer who can do all the basics with his eyes closed, but he relishes in being the go-to guy for electronic solutions, courageously encouraging his colleagues and clients to test the latest IT boundaries. His high energy and no-nonsense approach are refreshing, productive and effective.

Strategy Lead - Watson Marketing at IBM | Adjunct Lecturer of Integrated Marketing Communications at Northwestern
August 26, 2008, Ed worked with Len but at different companies

Len is a top-notch PR professional. He understands how to get the word out about his clients using various innovative methods, and is full of great ideas. He's willing to try new things to create buzz around his clients, and that innovation is what gets them noticed. Above all, Len is a stand-up guy. He's great to work with, and always willing to listen to something on behalf of his clients. If you are considering hiring someone to do your PR then you should definitely speak with Len. Not only is he a great writer, but he will work with you to build excitement around your business in a new and original way. He's someone that cares about his clients and that shows with all the work that he does.

Where other PR professionals charge you for numerous meetings just to hear your own ideas, Len Gutman gets you the results that you are looking for.

Michele Redmond, MS, RDN
Dietitian Chef & Food Enjoyment Activist Teaching, Speaking & Writing about Food & Eating Solutions  for  Living Well
August 8, 2016, Len worked with Michele but at different companies

I hired Michele to lead a series of grant funded cooking classes for fifth graders in Phoenix and it couldn't have gone better. Michele worked with my staff to plan and deliver this 12 class program over the course of a school year and everything went very smoothly. The classes were held in our teaching kitchen at the Halle Heart Children's Museum in Tempe, AZ and Michele worked with our equipment and set up; in fact, she made suggestions to improve our kitchen and we've since implemented those ideas.This was a difficult program because it was grant funded and the food requirements had to meet or exceed the strict guidelines of the American Heart Association. Michele came up with several great ideas using our curriculum and eventually settled on a great flat bread recipe that was healthy and fun for the kids. She instinctively knew the students would love to get their hands in the dough and create their own flatbread designs with the vegetables available. The other aspect of this program that made it so complicated was that we had never done anything like this in the Phoenix market and we had no idea what equipment we needed to buy. Michele provided us with an extensive list of equipment and now our kitchen is fully prepared for future cooking classes. MIchele also was able to bring several of her students to each class to serve as assistants and that proved to be invaluable as managing 25-30 fifth graders was no easy task and definitely a job for more than one person.I wouldn't hesitate to hire Michele again as she is easy to work with, a great chef and nutritionist and a very detailed and organized person.

Linda VandeVrede
Editor and Proofreader for B2B Content | Author | Retired PR Executive
March 7, 2016, Len worked with Linda but at different companies

Linda VandeVrede is the consummate communications professional with a wide range of skills and experience across nearly every discipline in her field. First and foremost, Linda is a skilled writer and editor and that serves as the cornerstone of her work. More than that though, Linda is extremely business savvy and takes every opportunity to stay up-to-date on the latest trends in the business world with a particular emphasis on entrepreneurism and technology. She has an unquenchable thirst for knowledge which manifests itself through her voracious reading and active participation in industry seminars, round tables and talks.I had the pleasure of working with Linda while we both served as bloggers at Valley PR Blog, which at the time was a very widely read professional community. Linda's voice was one of a teacher and mentor, always taking on subjects to help our readers learn more about the practice of public relations and communications. Her credibility was strengthened by the fact that she literally wrote the book on how to effectively build a strategy to promote a business and because of her leadership in this area her opinions were always valued by our readers.Linda has a great reputation in the communications field and she's a pleasure to work with, but mostly she's just a really great person.

summary: I have more than 25 years of experience in corporate communications and public relations. I'm currently a Foundation Relations Adviser at the American Heart Association where I manage a portfolio of foundation prospects and write grant proposals in order to fund the association's life-saving work.I am a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals. I am the author of Giving Time: Making A Difference in Your Community (Llumina Press, 2003) and was a columnist and contributing writer for the Arizona Republic. I'm an alumnus of Valley Leadership and in 2003 was selected as one of the Business Journal of Phoenix's "Forty Under 40".
name: Len Gutman
title: Partnering with foundations to create healthier communities
